headline.main: 3 MOP-UP COLUMNS JOIN ON ATTU SHORE; Troops Kill More Than 400 Japanese in Advance to Chichagof Harbor FEW OF ENEMY ARE LEFT Inspection of Airfield Begun by Invaders Shows Their Engineering Is Faulty

lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, June 1 -- A Navy communique today told of further progress of Army troops in mopping up the Japanese remnants on Attu Island in the Aleutians. Three Army spearheads beat down ''weak resistance" Sunday and effected a junction on the shores of Chichagof Harbor, killing more than 400 Japanese during the advance.
abstract: US Army group join, Chichagof Harbor advance; organized resistance ends; Jap airfield engineering front faulty, Attu
